responses.rationale: Describes a responsibility/capability ('responsible for inspecting') without active reassurance.
Describes requirements/capabilities ('required to be present', 'unfettered access') without active reassurance.
Describes a requirement/safeguard ('required to undergo daily inspections') without active reassurance.
Describes a safeguard/monitoring capability ('additionally monitored') without active reassurance.
Describes a measure ('mandated culling') and its consequence ('primarily an animal health issue') without active reassurance.
Describes a recommendation/safeguard ('recommends cooking... to reduce the potential') without active reassurance.
Asks a question about potential future price increases, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a current negative trend ('trending sharply higher'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a potential negative future possibility ('could be some shortages'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a current negative trend ('were also rising'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a potential negative future possibility ('could also become more volatile'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a hopeful future possibility ('restrictions... may be short-lived') without active reassurance.
Describes a process/capability ('Samples are sent to diagnostic labs') without active reassurance.
Describes a past/current event ('Outbreaks have been detected'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a past/current event ('had been detected'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a scale/metric of the problem ('totaled more than 17 million'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a required action/measure ('would be required to be euthanized to prevent the spread') without active reassurance.
Describes a specific instance and scale of the problem, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a specific instance and scale of the problem, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a specific instance and scale of the problem, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Asks a question about comparison, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a scale/metric of the problem ('Nearly 50 million birds died'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a consequence/impact ('has raised concerns'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes symptoms of the virus, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes characteristics and history of the virus, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a potential negative future impact ('impose a burden'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a consequence/reaction ('have halted imports'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a hopeful future possibility ('restrictions... may be short-lived') without active reassurance.
Describes a characteristic/scale of the current outbreak ('seeing more geographic spread'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Asks a question about potential actions/capabilities, not a statement of capability/preparedness.
Describes an emphasis on measures ('emphasized a hardening of 'biosecurity' measures') without active reassurance.
Describes specific measures ('Biosecurity measures include limiting access... and requiring... hygiene') without active reassurance.
Describes a risk factor ('can contribute to spreading'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a risk factor ('So can farm workers having contact'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes a recommended action/preparedness ('considering how to improve their biosecurity') without active reassurance.
Asks a question about a measure, not a statement of capability/preparedness.
Describes symptoms of the virus in birds, not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
Describes detection and a potential negative impact ('posing a likely threat'), not capability/preparedness/safeguard.
